emails.subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on rimi.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Hello, During our research on user account enumeration flaws on Estonian online services, we found that your website is vulnerable to the exposure of registered user email addresses. The vulnerability report is attached. We would appreciate it if you could confirm receipt of this email to prevent us from reaching out to you through other channels. Best regards, Gregor Eesmaa Computer Science MSc student University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

emails.subject: Undeliverable: User email address enumeration vulnerability on rimi.ee
emails.bodyHtml:
Your message to info@rimibaltic.com couldn't be delivered.
info wasn't found at rimibaltic.com.
gregor.eesmaa Office 365 info
Action Required Recipient
Unknown To address

How to Fix It
The address might be misspelled or might not exist. Try one or more of the following:
  • Retype the recipient's address, then resend the message - If you're using Outlook, open this non-delivery report message and click Send Again from the menu or ribbon. In Outlook on the web, select this message, and then click the "To send this message again, click here." link located just above the message preview window. In the To or Cc line, delete and then retype the entire recipient's address (ignore any address suggestions). After typing the complete address, click Send to resend the message. If you're using an email program other than Outlook or Outlook on the web, follow its standard way for resending a message. Just be sure to delete and retype the recipient's entire address before resending it.
  • Remove the recipient from the recipient Auto-Complete List, then resend the message - If you're using Outlook or Outlook on the web, follow the steps in the "Remove the recipient from the recipient Auto-Complete List" section of this article. Then resend the message. Be sure to delete and retype the recipient's entire address before clicking Send.
  • Contact the recipient by some other means, (by phone, for example) to confirm you're using the right address. Ask them if they've set up an email forwarding rule that could be forwarding your message to an incorrect address.
If the problem continues, ask the recipient to tell their email admin about the problem, and give them the error (and the name of the server that reported it) shown below. It's likely that only the recipient's email admin can fix this problem.

Was this helpful? Send feedback to Microsoft.

More Info for Email Admins
Status code: 550 5.4.1

This error occurred because a message was sent to an email address hosted by Office 365, but the address doesn't exist in the receiving organization's Office 365 directory. Directory Based Edge Blocking (DBEB) is enabled for rimibaltic.com, and DBEB rejects messages addressed to recipients who don't exist in the receiving organization's Office 365 directory. This error is reported by the recipient domain's email server, but most often it can be fixed by the person who sent the message. If the steps in the How to Fix It section above don't fix the problem, and you're the email admin for the recipient, try one or more of the following:

Check that the email address exists and is correct - Confirm that the recipient address exists in your Office 365 directory, is correct, and is accepting messages.

Synchronize your directories - Make sure directory synchronization is working correctly, and that the recipient's email address exists in both Office 365 and in your on-premises directory.

Check for errant forwarding rules - Check for forwarding rules for the original recipient that might be trying to forward the message to an invalid address. Forwarding can be set up by an admin via mail flow rules or mailbox forwarding address settings, or by the recipient via the Forwarding or Inbox Rules features.

Make sure the recipient has a valid license - Make sure the recipient has an Office 365 license assigned to them. The recipient's email admin can use the Office 365 admin center to assign a license to them (Users > Active Users > Select the recipient > Assigned License > Edit).

Make sure that mail flow settings and MX records are correct - Misconfigured mail flow or MX record settings can cause this error. Check your Office 365 mail flow settings to make sure your domain and any mail flow connectors are set up correctly. Also, work with your domain registrar to make sure the MX records for your domain are set up correctly.

For more information and additional tips to fix this issue, see this article.
Original Message Details

Sender Address: gregor.eesmaa@ut.ee
Recipient Address: info@rimibaltic.com
Subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on rimi.ee

emails.subject: RE: [Rimi DPO] Thank you - Paldies - Ačiū - Aitäh
emails.bodyHtml:
EN:

Hello! Thanks for reaching out to us. We will respond to a request related to processing of personal data as soon as possible and no later than within one month.

Best regards - Data Protection Function

Privacy Policy and Art.12 GDPR

 

LV:

Labdien! Paldies, ka sazinājāties ar mums.

Mēs atbildēsim uz personas datu apstrādes pieprasījumu iespējami ātri un ne vēlāk kā viena mēneša laikā.

Ar cieņu - Datu aizsardzības komanda

Privātuma politika un 12.p. VDAR

LT:

Sveiki! Dėkojame, kad susisiekėte su mumis. Atsakysime į prašymą, susijusį su asmens duomenų tvarkymu, kuo greičiau ir ne vėliau kaip per vieną mėnesį. 

Pagarbiai, Duomenų apsaugos komanda

Privatumo politika ir BDAR 12 str.

EE:

Tere! Täname, et pöördusite meie poole. Isikuandmete töötlemisega seotud päringule vastame esimesel võimalusel ja mitte hiljem kui ühe kuu jooksul.

Parimate soovidega – andmekaitsefunktsioon

Privaatsuspoliitika ja Art.12 IKÜM

 

 

 

PRIVACY NOTICE: Your privacy is important for us at RIMI. We are transparent with how we collect and process any personal data that you share with us. More detailed information on how we process your personal data can be found at Privacy section in RIMI’s home page.

Latvia

Lithuania

Estonia

ATTENTION: This e-mail may contain confidential information that is intended solely for the addressee. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, or distribution of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, is strictly prohibited.

emails.subject: RE: [EXT] User email address enumeration vulnerability on rimi.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Hello. Thank you for your email and for bringing this matter to our attention. We appreciate your efforts in researching potential issues and sharing your findings with us. We continuously assess and monitor the security of our services to ensure the protection of our users and their data. Your report will be reviewed as part of our ongoing security evaluations. Please rest assured that we are dedicated to maintaining the privacy and security of our users, and we will continue to monitor and improve our processes as necessary. Thank you once again for your cooperation. Best Regards RIMI Data protection function RimiDPO@rimibaltic.com Rimi Eesti Food AS Saue 10, Saue Vald, Harjumaa, Estonia www.rimi.ee Infot, kuidas me Sinu isikuandmeid töötleme leiad siit https://www.rimi.ee/Privaatsuspoliitika/kliendi-tagasiside-isikuandmete-tootlemine Mida teha, kui Rimi keeldub kaebust lahendama või kui Sa ei ole kaebuse lahendamisega nõus https://www.rimi.ee/Privaatsuspoliitika/pretensiooni-esitamine-kauplejale

emails.subject: Re: [EXT] User email address enumeration vulnerability on rimi.ee
emails.bodyHtml:
Hello,

We have conducted a follow-up reassessment of the service, and we appreciate your commitment to improving the security of your service. However, we also found that the account enumeration vulnerability is still not fully mitigated.

The attached updated report provides an overview of the remaining concerns and is intended to guide further corrective actions.

Best regards,
Gregor Eesmaa
Computer Science MSc student
University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

emails.subject: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses rimi.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on rimi.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Lugupeetud rimi.ee vastutav andmetöötleja Pöördun, et edastada ametlikult mure isikuandmete kaitse üldmääruse (IKÜM) alusel seoses minu isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses rimi.ee, mida pean ebaseaduslikuks ning mis võib viia nende avaldamiseni selleks volitamata isikutele ilma selge õigusliku aluseta. Manuses on ametlik taotlus (samuti digiallkirjastatud kujul), milles teostan oma õigusi IKÜM artiklite 15, 18 ja 21 alusel. Palun selle läbivaatust ja vastavate meetmete võtmist ajaraamis, mis on sätestatud IKÜM artiklis 12(3) (üks kuu taotluse saamisest). Palun teavitage taotluse kättesaamisest. Lugupidamisega Gregor Eesmaa -- Dear Data Controller of rimi.ee, I am contacting you to formally raise concerns under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) regarding what I believe to be the unlawful processing of my personal data by rimi.ee, potentially leading to its disclosure to unauthorised parties without a clear legal basis. Please find attached a formal application (also in digitally signed form) exercising my rights under Articles 15, 18, and 21 of the GDPR. I request that you review and act upon it accordingly, within the timeframe established by Article 12(3) of the GDPR (one month from receipt). Please confirm receipt of this request. Kind regards, Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: RE: [EXT] IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses rimi.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on rimi.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Dear Gregor, Thank you for contacting us with your concerns. At Rimi, personal data protection is a topic we take very seriously. We recognize its importance in today’s digital environment and treat it as a key consideration in our operations and decision-making. We follow information security practices aligned with industry standards. We process your personal data based on our legitimate interest to ensure IIT environment security. In more detail you can read in our Customer privacy policy: https://www.rimi.ee/privaatsuspoliitika/klient/sinu-rimi-kliendiprogrammi-ja-rimi-e-poe-isikuandmete-tootlemine. For mentioned processing, we have conducted a legitimate interest balancing test and concluded that the legitimate interests pursued are not overridden by the rights and freedoms of the data subjects. Following a reassessment of the legitimate interest balancing test, we have reaffirmed our original conclusion. The rights outlined in Article 18 and Article 21of the GDPR become applicable only when one of the specific conditions listed therein is met. In the present case, none of those conditions are fulfilled, and therefore the rights do not apply. We would like to indicate that enumeration vulnerability is a potential weakness in a system. It does not, in itself, involve the transmission, access, or disclosure of personal data unless exploited. In the case of enumeration, the system may respond differently to valid vs. invalid inputs. However, no actual personal data is disclosed unless the system returns identifiable information beyond mere existence. The mere confirmation of existence of a data point (e.g. a registered email) may not meet the threshold of disclosure unless it is accompanied by additional identifiable information or is used in a context that leads to identification of a data subject. The method used to exploit this vulnerability is beyond standard practice and required specialized knowledge and skills that most individuals outside the relevant field would not typically possess. If you are dissatisfied with our answer you can contact Data Protection Inspectorate in Estonia. https://www.aki.ee/ Best Regards RIMI Data protection function RimiDPO@rimibaltic.com Rimi Eesti Food AS Saue 10, Saue Vald, Harjumaa, Estonia www.rimi.ee Infot, kuidas me Sinu isikuandmeid töötleme leiad siit https://www.rimi.ee/Privaatsuspoliitika/kliendi-tagasiside-isikuandmete-tootlemine Mida teha, kui Rimi keeldub kaebust lahendama või kui Sa ei ole kaebuse lahendamisega nõus https://www.rimi.ee/Privaatsuspoliitika/pretensiooni-esitamine-kauplejale
